summary: This document is an email chain between US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff and others regarding Touhy requests from attorney Brad Edwards for information on Epstein victims. The emails discuss timing delays due to discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case and note that the requested individuals are not listed victims in the indictment.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney making Touhy requests for information on Epstein victims; communicating with USANYS about response timing.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: USANYS staff member who states they are swamped with Maxwell discovery and cannot respond substantively until after November 9th.

persons.name: Steven
persons.context: USANYS staff member who forwards six Touhy requests from Brad Edwards regarding Epstein victims.

persons.name: Maria Kelljchian
persons.context: Paralegal at Edwards Pottinger LLC who forwards Brad Edwards' Touhy requests to USANYS.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Copied on the email from Maria Kelljchian regarding the Touhy requests.

connections.description: Maria Kelljchian is a paralegal at Edwards Pottinger LLC, Brad Edwards' law firm, and forwards his requests.
Both are associated with Edwards Pottinger LLC, as Brittany Henderson is copied on the firm's correspondence.
Brad Edwards submits Touhy requests to the US Attorney's Office, where Steven is a point of contact.

events.title: Brad Edwards meeting
events.description: Brad Edwards mentioned he would be meeting with someone around November 4 and 5, and requested a response to his Touhy requests by then.

events.title: Maxwell discovery deadline
events.description: The US Attorney's Office cites a discovery deadline for the Ghislaine Maxwell case as the reason for delay in responding to Touhy requests.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301
keyFacts: Brad Edwards, an attorney, submitted six Touhy requests to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York seeking information on Epstein victims.
The US Attorney's Office stated they were too busy with discovery for the Ghislaine Maxwell case to respond substantively until after November 9, 2020.
The US Attorney's Office noted that none of the individuals named in the Touhy requests were listed as victims in their indictment (presumably referring to the Epstein or Maxwell indictment).
The correspondence reveals procedural delays and resource constraints within the US Attorney's Office during the Maxwell prosecution.
